fields.summary: iOS : Window - In KitchenSink > Base UI > Window (standalone) > Open (Nav Bar Visible) the nav bar isn't visible in landscape orientation

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
While testing Kitchensink, Base UI>Window (standalone), I opened the "Nav Covered" window and then rotated the device. The result was the new window was no longer covering the full width of the screen and showed the test window behind it. See screenshots. Occurs from landscape to portrait or vice-versa.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Install KS 1.8.0 on iPod 3rd gen.
2) Navigate to Kitchensink: Base UI>Window (standalone)
3) Tap "Open (Nav Bar Covered)" button
4) Rotate device

Result:
The new window does not fully cover the test window

Expected:
The new window adjusts to the change in orientation

Notes: 
Also occurs with SDK 1.7.2
fields.summary: iOS: Base UI>Window (standalone) - "Nav bar covered" window does not handle device orientation change correctly.
fields.environment: SDK 1.8.0.v20110819142548 on iPod 3rd Gen 4.0.2, Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.4.201108101535

comments.body:
Also occurs on:
SDK: 2.0.0.v20120327114816
Titanium Studio, build: 2.0.0.201203270923
Device: iPad 3 (5.1)

Occurs on:
Titanium Studio, build: 2.1.2.201208301612
Titanium Studio SDK, build:2.1.3.v20120925134611
Devices:
iPhone5 iOS-6
iPad3 iOS-6
Note: window does not handle orientation change correctly.
Resolving ticket as Invalid as there is now a new version of Kitchen Sink available and we no longer support the version which relates to this ticket.
